page.title: 04Industry in Yewdale
page.content: Our block contains the aptly-named {Coppermines Valley}(286987), which was an important centre for copper mining until the end of the 19th century. The Mines Royal Company started to extract copper ore from the sides of the{Old {Man}in the 16th century. The ore was transported by barge across{Coniston {Water}until the railway was opened in 1859. The workings are important examples of industrial archaeology. Slate quarrying developed in response to the demands of the industrial revolution, and has recently undergone a revival because of the aesthetic appeal of slate as opposed to tile and concrete. Today "green slate" is quarried at {Tilberthwaite}(312024), and there are many abandoned workings in the area. Lime was quarried for local use from a small outcrop by the A593 (309989).
